website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch traditional hand gripper that comes in a variety of strengths to suit your level.
pros: Comes in 11 different strengths ranging from 60 to 365 pounds
Made of durable metal that won't break or weaken over time
cons: Not everyone enjoys the rough metal grip

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I think mine is defective, i can't seem to squeeze it together
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.text: I have owned many strength training equipment and you can immediately tell the quality of work that went into this product. The Trainer (100lbs) is a decent entry level gripper for those that are already accustomed to compound lifts and anyone going past 3 plates dead lift would probably find it mildly challenging or at the very least a decent warmup. I've read many posts on forums that to avoid tendonitis you should start with a gripper level that you can comfortably do for 10-12 reps and move on from there. Great product and I will be ordering the heavier sets soon. Decent way to improve grip strength and endurance while lounging about at home.
customer_reviews.author: jinha

customer_reviews.title: They are sub standard
customer_reviews.text: Bought a bunch. Ordered 2 of the 1. After trying both of the same level there is no doubt in my mind that they are far from equal. If I can use one like a bich but cannot squeeze the other with out pain and extreme effort. That means they are not rated right which negates the gold standard and and certification.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed, the handle came apart the first time I used it. I was under the impression these were some of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: If you're serious about forearm strength, this is a must buy right now.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Captains of Crush No. 4 (365 lbs.) and the Gillingham High Performance Level 10 (425 lbs.) grippers. Buy them both, while you still can here in 2020. The Warren Tetting Zeus (535 lbs.), Thor (895 lbs.), and Hercules (1,800 lbs.) are almost impossible to find nowadays for sale, especially new versions of these grippers. The Hercules will obviously never be closed by a human. Warren retired from making them back in like 2014. So, the COC No. 4 and the GHP Level 10 are the hardest grippers left that you will likely be able to find on the market. I wish I knew about the Beef Builder Warren Tetting grippers years ago.
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: The quality on these are great and the grippers are solid and weighty. A FDNY captain recommended these and I have no regrets. I'm currently struggling to hang on to deadlifting 225 using the overhand grip and the trainer seems to be a good spot to start. I can hold it closed for 20 seconds on my right side and the left arm struggles to keep it closed for more than 5 seconds. Don't listen to the bad reviews on the knurling. If you lift moderate weights without gloves the knurling is perfect. Hopefully the spring doesn't snap but if they do there is a one year warranty. Will update review if any mishaps happen.
customer_reviews.author: Boots

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for grip strength
customer_reviews.text: The website recommends having 3 different grippers. The first one is referred to as the warm up gripper, it is used to warm up the muscles and ligaments, the second one is the strength that you're presently working on and this is where the majority of the work is done. The final gripper is the challenge gripper, it's the one that you want to get to and you do small reps with it after the real workout is complete. The system they have put together is working for me so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Black

customer_reviews.title: Joe Rogan Brought Me Here
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these "Trainer (100lbs)" grippers after listening to one of Joe Rogan's podcasts, and-- knowing how strong he is-- I got a lighter set than he. These grip trainers are awesome. Much stronger and higher quality than the ones I grew up with from stores like Big 5. My only complaint-- and it's a small one-- is that they are pretty brutal on your hands unless you've got a lot of fat or callouses. The machining is good, but the texture is just a bit aggressive so be aware of that. I will be ordering the No. 1 (140lbs) hopefully soon.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Counterfiet seller, beware.
customer_reviews.text: The official Captains of Crush grippers are great, HOWEVER, make sure you order exclusively from Iron Mind or a direct affiliate. There are a number of counterfeits on the market (the packaging is even identical). These fakes do NOT equate to the resistance of an official Captains of Crush gripper. (The "No. 2" counterfeit I recieved was easier to close than a legitimate "No. 1")
customer_reviews.author: I'm no Butters

customer_reviews.title: Be honest with yourself or these grippers will humble you quick.
customer_reviews.text: The trainer level humbled me. On purchase I couldn't close it consistently or for more than a few seconds. 3 weeks in and I've moved to the level 1. Not all of that progress is from just the grip trainer but it tracked proportionally with my pronated grip deadlifts. My deadlift went up so my grip improved, but right away the grip trainer helped me get higher weights on deads without using an alternated grip.
customer_reviews.author: Rob C.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely not a #2
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this is a knockoff or fake. Everything looks like my other grippers of the same name even the packaging? The handles look the same but the spring is the wrong color of chrome. Also it's tension is somewhere between my #1 and #1 1/2 but it is definitely not a #2.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hagmeier

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this thing today and first thing i noticed is how solid it is. It feels tough. I started out with the 100 pd one, might have made a mistake? I can do it about five times in a row. I think i could do more but The tread on it is rough on your skin if you are not used to it. Of course i could not put it down all afternoon so it shouldnt take long to toughen my skin but... i noticed tonight i have a big bruise on the inside of my hand? It looks like i must have burst a blood vessel lol. I hope it doesn't start hurting tomarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Should have went higher
customer_reviews.text: I started lifting a few months ago and had bought a cheap set of 10-50kg adjustable grips. I got to the point where I can close those easy but didn't think it was probably the right weight. I was wrong, just got my 100lb trainers today and can close them with ease. I decided to order a pair of the 1.5 rated at 167lbs which should be here this weekend. I guess I'll update my review later but I'm not big by any means. 6' 1" 185lbs with 2 months of training and the trainer isn't enough. If you have done even a little training I wouldn't spend money on the trainer series and go higher.
customer_reviews.author: Meat_Guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I had tried these things from a friend in school quite a few years back and remembered how difficult they were and the quality of the build. I climb fairly regularly at what I would consider an intermediate recreational level and on unboxing first try, I can’t close the level 1 COCs. This wasn’t necessarily surprising for me and I wanted a set to grow into so i am pleased with the purchase. The only negative is the high price. I can still train with these and get utility by squeezing an object of varying width at the base and holding it and doing negatives until I can close them.
customer_reviews.author: Rock&Ice

customer_reviews.title: Work great, too expensive, cheaper options available
customer_reviews.text: Extremely heavy duty. At first I could only do a few closes with my right hand and I couldn't even close them in my left hand. Now I can close them consistently in my left hand. In retrospect, there are much cheaper Brands out there that are almost exactly the same. By those instead.
customer_reviews.author: Green_Froggy

customer_reviews.title: Gold Standard
customer_reviews.text: This is the gold standard of grippers. Store bought grippers that say 200 lb "tire out" over time and become weaker than the easiest of CoC's grippers. I've had grippers for ten years that still perform at the same level, its insane. I bought a trainer recently and some other odds and ends as I swapped inventory. Same effort on both old and new. I replaced the old ones btw because I left them in poor conditions and they became tarnished and some rust worked its way into the knurling(sp?). Put them in my sonicator and scrubbed them and they're brand new. Not bad.
customer_reviews.author: pkwolf55

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Just Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Heard about these from Joe Rogan and they do not disappoint. Incredibly durable all metal construction. Worked my way from the 1st option (60 lbs) to currently using the 1.0 (140 lb). Had existing pains in my elbow and a week grip. No more elbow pain and my grip gets stronger with each step up I take through the system. I gave them a 5 for comfort because the grip etched into the handle keeps from slipping (which is more important to me), but these are physically Uncomfortable and will callous your hands. But so will lifting weights so I wouldn’t expect otherwise when you consider the resistance you’re getting from these.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Vicknair

customer_reviews.title: Tough Little Guy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tough! I work as a construction laborer so I use my hands a lot. I decided to go with the number 2 straight out of the gate and wow this thing is harder than I thought. I was able to close it with my dominate side first try but it is definitely no joke...so I decided to take it to work just to "gauge my strength" with the other guys. To my surprise none of the other guys could close it, several of which I would have thought could have. Anyway is made very durable and I would recommend starting lower if you aren't constantly working with your hands Great Product... looking forward to moving up!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: COC No3 280lb
customer_reviews.text: I had a 80lb one could do about 200 continious reps. So decided to buy the iron grip No3 since they said the No2 was to easy to close. tried to close it on my first try i have about an 1in left to go i'm 250lb 6'3 and do powerlifting. Hope this helps on choosing your iron grip.
customer_reviews.author: David Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hand Workout
customer_reviews.text: The hand exerciser is good for working out. But I bought one that was tougher than what my hands could do, so I purchased a smaller one to use to build up to the one I have now. Would recommend to a friend, definitely gives a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help me build up my grip strength and maybe even some forearm muscles. I keep them at work and use them all day. The quality is top notch and they feel exactly like they should. They are a bit rough in your hand on first use but you get used to them quickly. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a quality set of grippers. Do not waste your money on the cheap knock offs.
customer_reviews.author: Xerc

customer_reviews.title: Great for building grip strength
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased the trainer, 1, 1.5, and 2. All are still going strong and well made. Will likely get the 2.5 in a few months. Recommend a light one for reps and warmup and one you can close with some difficulty then one you can barely close and one you can't close without doing negatives or with assistance such as your other hand or against your leg. Edit: Working on the 2.5. It is tough. Hopefully, I can get it closed by christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Tyr Na Nog

customer_reviews.title: Quality! Success!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson who was just starting high school wrestling. The gripper was great! I got the training model for him and it was a struggle. Following the training recommendations, his grip strength has improved dramatically. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DVC

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great Gripper
customer_reviews.text: A well made gripper. I was using my old Weider plastic gripper for the past year until the spring finally broke. The Captains of Crush hand gripper is a 4.5 Stars product. I expected it not to squeak from the beginning but it does squeak. I will have to oil it. Strangely the instructions on the back of the blister pack card mentions instructional booklets on how to use the gripper but does not provide them when you purchase the COC gripper. The No. 1 I purchased is 140# grip and it is a good workout to close.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vaillancourt

customer_reviews.title: arrived a bit early
customer_reviews.text: it is insane i will never be able to close it one time i read about the guy who did two eightie for like twelve reps i'm telling you dude not this one not in this lifetime. i tried a strong man contest just for fun and i was able to lift the cylinders on the farmers walk at two hundred and sixty-five pounds each and walk with them but this thing i can barely close it for maybe a quarter of an inche. so if you whant a real challenge and you think you're up to it trust me you won't be disapointed. have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip training for artists not just body builders.
customer_reviews.text: I've been having mild wrist pain since I use a drawing tablet for at least 3 hours a day. I was concerned because I intend to start drawing more. I'd heard that training grip strength could help alleviate wrist pain. I bought this along with the expand your hand bands and have been using this daily along with some mobility exercises and I haven't had any problems with wrist pain since then. The grip trainer is really good quality. I feel like I could throw this thing at the ground 100 times and it'd still be fine. I expect I'll be using this for a long time. I plan to get the stronger trainers in a few months or so.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best out there. The knurling can be a little rough so if you have soft hands, you should probably check out their zenith models. I personally like roughing up my hands a little to strengthen the skin. I wasn't expecting to close the trainers but I can just barely hold them closed, which is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stay humble, my friend.
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal! I purchased the No.1 thinking it would be a breeze(since I use the Walmart brand...wrong answer! I got humbled expeditiously. I couldn't close it completely. So a couple of days later, I purchased the Trainer and the No.1 will be my "goal". Update: I purchased the trainer and I've been using it regularly(and seeing great results. I also purchased another Trainer so I could alternate my routine. I highly recommend you get the Trainer first...then graduate. CoC is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: terrencetanthony706

customer_reviews.title: Strong, durable and lasts
customer_reviews.text: Compared to most of the grippers out there coc is quality, strong and lasts. The pattern on the grip tends to break your skin initially but as you get stronger it gets better. It’s just like going to a gym
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Usam

customer_reviews.title: #2 is for guys with already strong grip! Pretty stiff but great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I wanted. Got the #2 because I have always been into fitness and baseball and have a strong grip. It is perfect for me. I can’t quite close it all the way but can get close enough to get a good workout in. Should be closing it soon! I am 230, squat and deadlift around 400, to give you an idea for comparison on the difficulty of the #2. Great product, well made, slight squeak but easily fixable.
customer_reviews.author: Kel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's also great for letting your passengers try out to see how ...
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my car and use it when I'm driving. Helps if you ever get mad at other drivers. It's also great for letting your passengers try out to see how hard it is to close all the way. Even though this is the "trainer" level, I still found it very hard to close all the way at first, so I would highly recommend this one if you have never really done grip training before. Soon I will move up to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are tougher than I thought. I can deadlift ...
customer_reviews.text: These are tougher than I thought. I can deadlift and barbell hacksquat 400 for reps without straps or losing grip so I figured I would start at Hand Gripper 2.5 but I can't quite fully close these yet. If you find yourself in the same position, you can close it with 2 hands and then hold it closed with one hand until your grip finally gives (i.e. negative rep). Turning them upside down is another variation. These aren't weak or flawed in any manner I can see. They're legit. Anyone that can fully close the highest level of these would be a monster.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S. Inglis

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t get product ordered. Not pleased
customer_reviews.text: The product I received is not what’s shown in photo and doesn’t appear to be a captains of crush product at all. Not pleased with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: mydog&me_83

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend these. Good quality, and sturdy. Only downside is the grip is also metal, I wrapped mine with duct tape, problem solved. Cannot complain, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: If you can't handle the grip, then you have more problem than just weak hands...
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built hand grips. Much better that the cheap ones at wal-mart. To all the people complaining about the rough knurling I say if your hands can't handle this, then you need to work up some callouses. I mean what is the point of having a strong grip if you can't even use it for fear of getting a blister? That's like only working out your biceps and neglecting your back muscles. Sure they might look pretty, but they aren't gonna do you much good. Oh and if they squeak just apply some dry lubricant like graphite to them. (Use the graphite from a pencil)
customer_reviews.author: Kase

customer_reviews.title: Lineman Approved
customer_reviews.text: I own multiples of these grippers. They are absolutely fantastic. They hold up well and they do exactly what they are designed to do, build crushing hands. As a power lineman I already had strong hands, but these grippers can take you to the next level and aid in the hand fatigue that often affects those of us who spend a good amount of time in rubber gloves and sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know if I should give a 1 or 5 star for "ease of use"
customer_reviews.text: Humbles lots of guys who think they're really strong. This is a really good size if you have strong hands for a guy. Most men won't be able to close this at first. Even if you can close it readily, pumping more than a few time is quite hard. Don't go higher until this one isn't a problem to close or you're just wasting money. Really good build quality, I've close it at least a thousand times and it's holding up perfectly. The grip that people say hurts, is important to keep it steady in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grip training
customer_reviews.text: I got the Number 1.5. I've always thought I had a strong grip but really wanted to improve those muscle groups and work on the mechanics of gripping. These are great and I will be upgrading to the "2" soon since sets of 8-12 for speed or 5x5 for strength are becoming easy. I use them throughout the day at random intervals. I met a carpenter and when I shook his hand he said, "You have the handshake of a craftsman." Now if I can only get a girlfriend ;_;
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Sport - A good starting point
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how the lbs listed for each type would feel for me, but I would like to share how the Sport feels given some of my current weights in the gym. I bench 185, standing overhead press 115, curl 65 on a curl bar etc (all for 10-12 reps). I have always had grip issues, but the Sport I can fairly easily close for 10-12 reps. If your numbers are higher than mine or similar, I would suggest starting at the Trainer, as I would believe my grip strength is disproportionately weak. Remember though, it's better to go one weight lower than higher if you will be training for volume (which you should) for grip strength.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Regular guy. Medium hands. No training recommends 0.5
customer_reviews.text: Yes. The quality is amazing compared to the competitors. Had hand surgery and was looking for a little extra help to get back to normal. Im a regular guy that works computers all day so really nice to grab and get in a rep a few times a day. Great conversation starter too. I ordered the 0.5 and it’s perfect. I have medium hands and a typical dad build. Lol. If you a regular guy I would recommend the .5 for a starting point.
customer_reviews.author: Mj1231

customer_reviews.title: Captains of Crush Grippers
customer_reviews.text: Captians of Crush makes the best, calibrated, solid, well made grippers on the market. If you want to increase hand/arm strength, hand grippers are the way to go. And a set of CofC hand grippers are excellent. I have the trainer through 2.5. And ten grips with each hand starting from the trainer working up to the 2.5 is a great workout. And it's a healthy workout, too. There are studies that show squeezing is very good for blood circulation and reducing blood pressure. Regardless of the health improvement, it does increase the strength in your arms. And it gives you a nice pump.
customer_reviews.author: GREVIEWS

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners. The tool itself works great and you can feel the workout is working. But unfortunately, whoever designed this might actually be mentally challenged. The grip material is a rough, rigid, metal with raised bumps. So after using this for a few minutes, your hands will start to blister , and or, you will receive cuts or skin peeling. I work in the service industry so I need my hands, I used the tool for about 20 minutes and my skin is literally cut off, I have sores now.. so yeah, great product, absolutely terrible execution. Like.. add a grip. What’s wrong with these people??
customer_reviews.author: Aaron cruz

customer_reviews.title: A significant jump from the T-level CoC grippers
customer_reviews.text: I started with the T (100 lbs) and after working up to the ten-reps-is-easy mark, bought the No. 1 (140 lbs). I wish that I'd gone with the 0.5 (120 lbs), as 100 to 140 lbs is slightly too big a jump for me to continue to make progress. Ass with all the CoC grippers, the knurling is brutal. Expect blisters, abrasion, and eventually some calluses. They're supposed to be like that though, but I figured I should note it here in case anyone is new to these. Stick with it!
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne T. VanWinkle

customer_reviews.title: Painful to use without gloves
customer_reviews.text: Quality product and extremely durable, but the knurled aluminum handle tear up the skin on your hands. The only way to use them regularly, or even occasionally without pain, is to wear gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Hoss

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made - grips are perfect, I'm not sure what the previous reviewer fuss is about unless they've changed the checkered pattern. It is comfortable and heavy duty and feels like it could last a lifetime. I bought 0.5 being of average strength, but I can't close it all the way (end points touching) one time. I can do reps closing it about halfway on my strong side and a little less on my weak side. I think I could have definitely started with trainer weight and moved up later. Regardless this is a great tool - thanks Chris Sajnog for the recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: KennyD

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is harder to close then I thought, form is really important and I'm still learning it, but to put in perspective where this is at, I can pick up 60lbs on the iron mind hub and I'm just a hair away from closing this
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Denham

customer_reviews.title: A Work Out
customer_reviews.text: I've been using grips for many years as a part of my strength training. However, these work at a totally higher level. These grips are really difficult to do. They push you to increase your strength. This is a good thing BTW. Time will tell but they have every appearance of being very well made. I give them my very strong recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

customer_reviews.title: Feels like 100lbs.
customer_reviews.text: I also have the 100lb version from Heavy Sports and the difference in terms of actual resistance is obvious. This product takes noticeable more hand strength than the Heavy Sports version. I would speculate that Captains of Crunch is calibrated and designed correctly. Outside of this, it is superb quality. It feels abrasive but still comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: tejanoman

customer_reviews.title: Good product for strengthening grip.
customer_reviews.text: Good product but this one had some issues with squeaking even after some balistol and has after some use very deep gouges in the metal where the arms meet the circle. My several others don't do this and have smooth glossy metal on the circle curve rather than rough grayed metal with scratches noticeable to touch. I think it must have sat in a warehouse for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tyr Na Nog

customer_reviews.title: Proper Gripper
customer_reviews.text: These things are no joke. Awesome quality and definitely a new standard compared to all those other grippers out there. Just be sure to read the online supplemental training material for how to properly use these things and you'll quickly see the results.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Grip Strengthening
customer_reviews.text: I have three sets of these!!! Have had them for years! I have Developed great hand and grip strength as well has developed forearms with these grip strengthens! Not the crap you get from Wal-Mart! These are the real deal!!! Go light at first then build up to. My highest one are at 167lbs and it’s a beast!!! At least for me!
customer_reviews.author: FOO

customer_reviews.title: I have used various hand grippers for years now. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used various hand grippers for years now. None can compare with the Captains of Crush Grippers. I purchased the 1.5, the 2 and the 2.5 grippers. I can handle the 1.5 and the 2, but the 2.5 continues to humble me. I will get there. Be aware that these grippers are way harder than others on the market and that your success with other grippers will not transfer over to the Captains of Crush. Start lighter than you think you are capable of handling.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Home Gym for your Hands
customer_reviews.text: Great gripper! If I keep working with this i will have brick crushing grip in no time! Seriously this gripper is just the first of the series and I am a big guy and its work to close fully. I may never reach full captain crush rank 3 or 4 but just working with this one as much as I have has made my grip much stronger and the gripper has shown no signs of use at all. This is gym quality equipment you can throw in your gym bag!
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuyFromKy

customer_reviews.title: Well made, not the most comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: Classic gripper, these are well made and since there is no plastic, they should last. The grips are not super comfortable for me, they feel small. The diamond checkering gives good grip, but it's sharp and somewhat annoying with bare hands. It would be nice to see larger diamater handles, either that or they should smooth out the checkering a bit. I bought 2 different weights, and both were accurate.
customer_reviews.author: welder314

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY THE GREATNESS YOU EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 0.5 since I’m a beginner but let me tell you that this is even a really tough one. The look and feel of it is amazing. High quality meshed with durability this is definitely a product I’ll be purchasing when I move up to the 1. In retrospect I should’ve started with one lower than this but in all I’m really satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent grippers. Very high quality materials and construction. The knurling on the handles helps keep them from slipping. They're available in a wide range of strength ratings, so you can get some that match your ability.
customer_reviews.author: SilverSurfer

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: Knurl feels like a barbell. Expensive, but seemingly built to last hundreds of years.
customer_reviews.author: the_twelves

customer_reviews.title: Great product to improve your grip
customer_reviews.text: I was listening to a podcast and it had an episode on how important the strength of your grip is. So I bought this to work on my grip and I have beens so pleased with it. It is a great product that is sturdy and built to last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pershing

customer_reviews.title: Best hand gripper hands down
customer_reviews.text: First time purchasing and using the CoC hand gripper. Excellent quality and extremely durable. The trainer is fairly a good starting point for those who want to just jump right in. We can only hope to add more to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.M.

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a teenager to get his hands stronger for sports. I initially bought the easiest one and then keep going up to harder hand grips as he gets stronger. It definitely works and the quality is unbelievable, I think it would be hard to find a better quality hand gripper on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Konodave

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The best grip-strength tool I've ever used. I'm very impressed with the quality all-metal construction, and with how hard it is to close. This puts other grippers to shame. The metal can feel a little rough on your hands if you're not used to working out with a barbell or something similar. I've only heard this from some friends who tried it, to me I think the grip is great. Overall would absolutely recommend this and may give it as a gift in the future.
customer_reviews.author: ReidEQ

customer_reviews.title: Harder than you think
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the no.1 for a few days now. I would like to think I am a pretty active person and strength train with barbells regularly, but this is tough to close. A few of my friends that do not regularly workout were not able to come close to closing it. I’m not able to consistently close it, but I guess that’s the point. This is not your grandpa grip trainer. Also- the knurling is rough on these, expect blisters if you hands aren’t already calloused from other sources.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: The #1 is Tough
customer_reviews.text: I’m an experienced lifter and I had a hard time closing the #1 5 times. Decided to order the Sport. Now I can close it 10 times, with some burn at rep 10, but the last 2-3 reps are hard.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Solid Durable Gripper
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been working out consistency for 2 years and looking to take it to the next level. I heard strengthening hand grip will help with various lifts. Got the Trainer grip and can’t close them fully yet, so it was a good grip to start with. I went with the recommendation and glad I did. Solid construction is an understatement. It doesn’t slip and is comfortable for me as I already have callouses from lifting. I will definitely get the next grip up when I can routinely close the Trainer grip.
customer_reviews.author: Ashtray520

customer_reviews.title: Break some hands
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to increase my grip strength because I tend to have a recurance of tennis elbow and those joke grippers you get at sporting goods stores are too weak. I do not do grip specific training but I lift weights most days. I bought the Number 1, it’s challenging but I am able to close it repeatedly. I think that’s a good place to start if you are an experienced lifter but new to grip training.
customer_reviews.author: TheJos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heavy pull grippers
customer_reviews.text: Heard Captains of Crush mentioned in passing on Joe Rogan podcast as a gripper that goes up to 300lb. I haven't worked on my grip in a few years due to injury, currently pulling 170lb, so getting back into it I started low at #1 (140lb)... which is a great start. The pull feels natural. Some limitations with spring binding, added a couple drops of 3 in 1 oil to spring to cure, but would recommend heavier lubricant in the future. Grips were rough on my hands at first, but got better with use. Edit: Just graduated to #2. Big jump, would recommend going up in 1/2 increments.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G. Gault

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed my expectations by a long shot.
customer_reviews.text: Underestimated this area of training for years. Never in my days of bodybuilding did I think I would need to specifically focus on grip training. The real world strength gains I’ve received using these grippers shocked me. It happens fast with diligent use. Upon progressing several stages onward from the trainers these grip trainers have me recommending Captains of Crush to anyone looking for gains in their athletic or work endeavors.
customer_reviews.author: Euge

customer_reviews.title: Get these!
customer_reviews.text: I can honestly say these are the highest quality hand grippers I've ever had. I almost didn't buy these because of the reviews that said the knurling would eat your hands up. I'm a diesel mechanic in the military and can say these have no effect on the skin on my hands. They feel just like the grips on a standard bench press bar to compare. My only regret is not buying the #1 instead of the trainer as my wife was almost able to fully close the trainer her first try and other than our child she doesn't lift weights.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Go 1 step higher than u think u need.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to graduate from my 90lb to the 120lb and it isnt much more difficult. One of the grippers I have may be labeled incorrectly. Anyways, the construction feels solid and if uoure looking to have a crushing grip using these is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: P H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, leave your ego at the door.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking I'd be one of the few able to crush it on the first try. Definitely don't make the same stupid mistake I did. This is a solid well-engineered product but not something to jump right into. Read the buying recommendations on the CoC. My first try on this gripper left me feeling like a twig, I love how it not only checked my ego but opened a whole new world of grip training for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you work out this is definitely an item to have
customer_reviews.text: I already have the 167.5 lb and a 237.5 lb. I'm years past 60 and decided I wanted a warm up so I bought these 80 lb 'ers.. strictly to loosen up before I get to the higher weights to workout. It's a lot easier on Old muscles to warm up better...
customer_reviews.author: bailenforcer357

customer_reviews.title: The first step on your journey to ridiculous forearms
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheap hand gripper from a well-known sports store that was supposedly 100 lbs. It wasn't. I could close that thing 10 times in a row without an issue but I couldn't close this one for three weeks. I can close it now, so don't make fun of me. Next month I'll step up to the .5. One day I dream of having the forearms of a Greek god by being able to do the CoC level 3 daily. One day.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Product
customer_reviews.text: These will really work to increase your grip strength. Bet they last a really long time.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, can't wait to get a stronger one
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 135 lbs and I've never felt so strong watching 180lb men be unable to close the 1.5. My job involves a lot of wrist strength and even so it took me about a month of using this every day to be able to close it with both hands. Definitely recommend one of these it will give you a confidence in your strength that most people don't have watching your wrist muscles develop so quickly, just make sure you watch a video on the proper technique so you're getting the most out of it
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Grip for days
customer_reviews.text: I can close a 88lbs adjustable gripper 20 times a set at the 88lbs setting, I bought the 0.5 that’s rated 120lbs and it was an easy close , just ordered the 1.0 140lbs. My 0.5 does squeak throughout the close so it does get noisy at the job but hey it’s COC 😁
customer_reviews.author: rmj576

customer_reviews.title: Secret dual purpose device...
customer_reviews.text: I decided I needed to strengthen my grip some, as I have noticed myself losing strength overall as I age... not exactly a shocker. The knurled metal grips on these dug into my hands a bit at first, but now the skin is beginning to callus back up so they almost look like a set of working mans hands again. Suits me just fine. They strengthen the skin as well as the muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Arntson

customer_reviews.title: Easily helped out with arm wrestling peopel 100lbs heavier than ...
customer_reviews.text: I order this pair as my second pair to build my wrist up for boxing again..... It deff is the next step up in weight. hard to get going at first, but youll get stronger. Easily helped out with arm wrestling peopel 100lbs heavier than me for free drinks. Made it's money back in one night at the tavern ;)
customer_reviews.author: JonnyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product - As always
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Captains of Crush Gripper I've bought, it is surprisingly considerably more difficult than the Trainer (100lbs). I can easily do 20-30 fully closed reps with the trainer, the level 1, I struggle to fully close it 5-6 times. Can't wait till I can close the level 1 grippers 20-30 times so I can buy the 1.5 or the 2.0!! or both :)
customer_reviews.author: Deric Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great for grip strength
customer_reviews.text: Best grippers around. The trainer and the #1 are a good place to start. Don’t try starting with a #2. You won’t likely be able to keep it closed metal to metal for more than a second if you do.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Strengthener
customer_reviews.text: The gripper is very well made and sturdy. Wasn't sure which one to start with so I chose the Sport (80 lb) reasoning that if it was too much I could always step down one, build strength, and then use this one as the next step up. Turns out it was the perfect place to start for me. I've been using it for three weeks now and am seeing results already. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CMcLane

customer_reviews.title: I Made Captains Of Crush a part of Me
customer_reviews.text: I started grip training a year ago to get my hands stronger and i honestly bring the hand gripper around with me everywhere. Its satisfying to close whenever im stressed, or to show friends how impressive it really is!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline D. Petrov

customer_reviews.title: Fake product
customer_reviews.text: This product is a fake. It looks slightly different from the other packaging and the product itself is slightly different. Real CoC won't be held together with zip ties. Just go buy them from the actual company. Waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: pouncer11

customer_reviews.title: They won't break
customer_reviews.text: My previous hand gripper had a plastic handle which exploded on me driving to work on a cold winter morning, a fragment of which nearly took out an eye. These CoC's appear to be pretty bulletproof.
customer_reviews.author: Zip

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grip trainers
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grip trainers. Start with one of the three trainer models, trust me. The 80lb one was surprisingly challenging for a guy who can deadlift 300lbs. As for people complaining aboit the knurl being too rough...yeah...not calling them whiney little female dogs or nothing but...yeah. I use the handles as a roller on my palms after I go to the climbing gym and find it feels great and my girlfriend says it makes my hands silky smooth. Awesome product. Only downside is the squeeking. A few drops of gun oil and they've been quite silent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Build grip strength
customer_reviews.text: I already had a Sport and #1, and decided that I needed a new challenge. These grippers are very well made and will really build up grip strength. Only complaint would be that the knurling tends to get pretty gross with dead skin build up, but it cleans out easily enough with a wire brush.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Schiffelbein

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I love these hand grippers . Unfortunately while using one it snapped . Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strength training, safety, great grip training product.
customer_reviews.text: Second COC, started with the 1, went straight to this and i love them. Had trouble with the 1 being loud originally but some good oil stopped that in its tracks day 1. No noise off the number 2 yet but i know how to fix it easy. Recommend this for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Swigart

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed, Expensive, No Foam.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing, expensive without protective foam to use for gripping. I can't find foam to purchase for in able to use in a long term...maybe I'm going to find something can protect my hand for gripping this.
customer_reviews.author: Shutter Speed

customer_reviews.title: The handles
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the handles, they are too harsh on the hands, they should make a comfortable cover. Also I accidentally purchased the one that has 280lbs instead of the 235lbs one.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Canabal

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I think it is pretty cool that they use these as a standard so it really speaks to the quality. I can't say comfortable because it's a hand gripper and it is what it is. I recommend it though - highly.
customer_reviews.author: Bobandee

customer_reviews.title: Top notch quality
customer_reviews.text: These are tough ! I started with the No. 1 (140 lbs) . Once I got up to 3 sets of 10 I needed the next challenge. I was vacillating between the 1.5 ( 167 lbs ) and the no. 2 ( 200 ) lbs. I m glad I only went up one. I can only get 2 sets of 5 currently. These trips are more expensive than others but completely worth it. The quality is excellent. They are truly the best grippers I have come across. If you are serious about improving your grip,these will take it to the next level ! If you buy these you won t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: gene hughes

customer_reviews.title: Has made a big difference in grip strength
customer_reviews.text: Great product, well built. A little rough on the hands but you really need the grip to keep your hand from slipping. I only have one spot that is tender and I'm confident that my hands will toughen up
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: High quality and accurate but grip is too rough.
customer_reviews.text: COC grippers are high quality and probably the standard. The only issues are the grips are unnecessarily rough and quite expensive. I would rather concentrate on grip strength than have to deal with torn up hands. I couldn't use them after use a few times, until my hands healed. I suppose one could sand down the texture to make it less rough. I don't mind paying more than competitors as long as they keep making the in the USA. I got the 140.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable Product for Functional Strength Building
customer_reviews.text: I am fairly athletic and have been weightlifting for about three years now, and I find the trainer suits my needs perfectly. The machined metal is high quality and durable. I've noticed an improvement in my hand and forearm strength since I began using this hand gripper. This sort of training is a good supplement for weightlifting and sports like Jiu Jitsu where you need to be able to grab an opponent and hold on tightly. If you're looking to build practical strength, do yourself a favor and get a gripper from COC rather than a cheaper alternative from a sporting goods store. This thing will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome to build squeeze strength
customer_reviews.text: Great grip workout if you do it effectively and not too often for beginners start with T [100lbs] try to hit 30 reps on it then move up to 1 which should be no problem hit 20 on it then move up again till you can hit 20 on the next one
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The Ironmind brand speaks for itself. I wouldnt choose another gripper. I have purchased many products from this company and I have never been dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: mike28

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: For a martial artists who relies on strong grips, this product challenges the strongest of hands. I have a no.2 and 3. I haven’t met anyone who can squeeze the end of these hand grips.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Jiu Jitsu

customer_reviews.title: Captains of crush? More like captains of break someone else's hand.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a while now and can definitely see results from consistent use. My once fragile, child like, hands are now the destroyer of egos. I now watch, with a sly smirk, as the eyes buldge out of the person's hand I'm shaking. My hands used to feel like soft melted butter but now are the equivalent of 60 grit sandpaper. Only downside is personal time is a lot more painful. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic, I bought until I couldn't close...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one gripper at a time until I couldn't close it. I am stopped at the #3 right now, but I have a few other ironmind items coming to help me close a #3.
customer_reviews.author: J. Drumheller

customer_reviews.title: THE Way to Improve Your Marksman's Grip
customer_reviews.text: I read Chris Sajnog'swhere one of the main tenants is having and maintaining a strong grip. He suggests Captains of Crush, and I can see why. They're extremely well-made, are definitely improving my grip (and overall platform), and are pretty awesome to have on the trail to keep your hands from swelling (pooling).
customer_reviews.author: WolfeLogic

product_meta.title: IronMind Captains of Crush Hand Gripper The Gold Standard of Grippers and The World's Leading Hand Strengthener
